revisionDesc.change: Vote - AcceptText - Fine. I agree with N. Gonis' reading in l. 3. Remove the p. in the correction in l. 6: N. Gonis, ZPE 208, 2018, 187.

Vote - AcceptText - Fine except for σκυ̣τεύς in lin3: -της looks clear (the second ε in lin2 εὐσεβεστάτου does tilt backwards at the top, but this is different) => keep as it was, but without the brackets.

Submit - New readings in l. 3 (σκυ̣τεύς) and l. 4 (ἀμφώτεροι). Several indications of trema which has been recognized by the editor only in ϊδιαν in l. 6. It consists regularly of only one dot, not two, which is normally written above initial ι and υ, but in case of a huge ι on the left hand side of the letter in middle height or on the base line, cfr. ϊνδ/ in l. 2 and ϊωαννης in l. 3. In the app. of l. 3 (second occurrence) and l. 4 „ϋιος papyrus“ does not appear, although I wrote it in the same manner as in l. 6 and the first time in l. 3. I also added corrections of BL I 9 and of Gonis in l. 6.

Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - The ed.pr. offered the reading [ ̣ ̣ ̣ ̣ ̣ ̣ πο]μαρίτης at the beginning of lin4. As πο] of [πο]μαρίτης is supplemented there is no reason to regularize the spelling. The supplement should be corrected to [πω]μαρίτης. On the image, however, there is a clear trace before the mu. Thus, I think, it is better to correct to [π]ωμαρίτης. One may observe that in the handwriting of this text the last part of the letter is swung round to close with the middle stroke.
